intro: Ficus nobilis, commonly known as the rubber tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves and can grow up to 30 meters tall in its natural habitat. The plant is a member of the Moraceae family and is known for its ability to produce latex, which is harvested for industrial use. Its roots and leaves are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The rubber tree thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
